title: La Vis 2012 Greggi Lagrein (Trentino)
description: Round and simple, this offers aromas and flavors of ripe blackberry, fleshy dark cherry, black plum and a hint of black pepper. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

title: Labouré-Roi 2013  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This wine is lean, with fresh acidity and stalky, dry fruitiness. The tannins and the intense acidity suggest a wine that is not going to broaden out and will always be on the austere side. Drink from 2017. This is one of the first vintages since Labouré-Roi, which was hit by scandal in 2012, passed into new ownership.

title: Putah Creek 2010 Tannat (Solano County)
description: With full body, very ripe aromas and flavors and a gripping, tannic texture, this could almost be a Port. It tastes like dark chocolate, dried figs and blackberry and has plenty of power on the tongue and on the finish. Pairing with blue cheese would be a good idea.

title: Santa Rita 2014 120 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Dry, scratchy plum and raspberry aromas come before an energetic palate. Loud berry and plum flavors run quick and bright, finishing with candy-like cherry flavors and wham-bam acidity.

title: Chono 2012 Entre Cordilleras Dalca Series Red (Cauquenes Valley)
description: While this is piercing, aggressive and herbal on the nose, there's enough rustic authenticity, licorice and cherry character to push it along. A raw palate offers oak-based flavors of vanilla and coconut but also tart plum and currant. A wiry, shearing finish tastes oaky and feels hard.

title: Clos LaChance 2012 Whitestone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: From vineyards that surround the winery in San Martin, this wine offers stony aromas of black slate and earth but only the tiniest bit of plum fruit. Dark red-cherry fruits show on the palate along with cedar, and it's rather light in body though with grippy tannins.

title: Cosentino 2013 The Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a full-bodied and intensely fruity wine with jammy aromas and ripe cherry and raspberry flavors. It is smooth textured and has soft tannins, so the effect is easygoing in spite of high alcohol.

title: Billhook 2013 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Brick and black-rock earthiness mixes with slightly sour black cherry in this smartly priced blend of 55% Syrah, 30% Grenache and 15% Petite Sirah. The palate shows tart red currant fruit and sagebrush.

title: Brennan 2013 Reserve Tempranillo (Texas)
description: Red cherry and currant mix with sweet sawdust and anise-spiced gum on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a plush feel, juicy red fruit flavors pervade on the palate. Light tannins make this an easy sipper—enjoy alone or with lighter proteins.

title: Calcu 2012 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)
description: Candied raspberry and plum aromas are ripe and simple. This feels quite tannic and rubbery, while flavors of cherry, mixed berries and chocolate convey a sense of sweetness. A fresh but rough finish clocks this out.

title: Nardello 2012 Monte Zoppega  (Soave Classico)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, candied citrus, pressed white flower and vanilla lead the nose and follow through to the palate, along with nectarine zest and baked apricot. Enjoy soon to capture the remaining freshness and fruit.

title: Joseph Fritsch 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: The earthy nose does no justice to the full, ripe fruit on the palate of this rounded, rich wine. There is some phenolic bitterness that is not unpleasant around the edges and a smidgeon of sweetness balanced by orange zest.

title: Kalfu 2013 Kuda Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Rosy in color, with gritty, earthy aromas of dried red fruits and horse, this coastal Pinot is lean, tangy and citric in the mouth. Pie cherry, tomato and oregano flavors finish zippy, short and with a tomato sauce aftertaste.

title: Miguel Torres 2012 Santa Digna Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Solid but flat aromas of olive and leafy berry fruits introduce a midland palate of moderate bounce and average body. Raspberry, plum, currant and herbal flavors finish fresh, but also woody and slightly bitter in taste.

title: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Limited Reserve Syrah (Finger Lakes)
description: Savory smoked nuts accent concentrated black cherry and plum flavors on this ripe but elegant Syrah. It's cranberry bite is a bit sharp in edge, but its approachable, juicy character and plush mouthfeel is pleasant.

title: Mackinaw Trail 2012 Cabernet Franc (Michigan)
description: A tart red-currant tone is deepened by streaks of blackberry and granite in this medium-bodied Cab Franc. Showing adequate structure from the tannins and acidity, this wine progresses nicely from the fruity start to the vanilla-dusted finish.

title: Montevina 2013 Omira Hills Chardonnay (California)
description: Pleasant floral aromas and sunny fruit-bowl flavors meet light buttery, earthy touches in this rather light-bodied wine. This shows nice complexity on the palate, with pear, peach and apple flavors.

title: Old Soul 2013 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Interesting nuances of honey, peach and spiced pear light up this medium-bodied, extremely fruity and flavorful wine. It's opulent and soft enough to pair well with spicy food or to serve with salty cheeses.

title: Haak 2013 Dry Blanc du Bois (Texas)
description: This bottling of an American hybrid grape demonstrates a floral side of the variety, with potpourri aromas riding over lychee and grapefruit. Green apple-skin flavors mark the light-bodied palate while sprtizy acidity keeps everything energized.

title: Hess Collection 2014 Shirtail Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This stainless-steel bottling shows overwhelming white-flower elements on the nose, from tuberose to honeysuckle to jasmine, cut by a bit of baking soda. The palate is so floral and aromatic that it almost tastes like a different grape, with sharp apples, more tuberose and a steely frame.

title: Saint Gregory 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Full body, a broad texture and very ripe flavors give both heft and softness to this cedar- and brown-sugar-scented wine. The ample fruit flavors taste mature and fully ripe, like dried plums.

title: Santa Alicia 2013 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)
description: This Merlot gets going with scratchy berry and plum aromas that come alongside roasted overtones. Choppy and tannic on the palate, this is short on flavors, with baked, loamy berry notes leading to a lightly herbal, briny tasting finish.

title: Sostener 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Simple but classy aromas of red currant and raspberries show on the nose of this bottling from an all-star team of the appellation. The palate is light and easy, with tart cranberry and a large boost of tannic grip, a surprise for how light it feels.

title: St. Julian 2013 Reserve Traminette (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: A heady, floral aroma of rose petal meets faint tones of grapefruit rind and unripe tropical fruit on the nose. Round in weight, the palate is riper in character, with an additional note of honey on the close.

title: Domaine Gavoty 2014 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A fragrant and fruity wine, this is full of red-raspberry and orange-zest flavors. It is full, with a light touch that comes from the acidity and tangy aftertaste.

title: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Nose and palate are full of juicy, rose-scented plums. A good dose of sweetness boosts those flavors even more, but fails to create overall balance. This is rather rich and full bodied.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2011 Estate Bottled Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Touches of vanilla, spice and smoked nuts lend complexity to straightforward apple, lemon and pear flavors in this dry, medium-bodied Chardonnay. It's refreshing and easy drinking with a brisk, clean finish.

title: LangeTwins 2011 Midnight Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: Jammy aromas, sweet-seeming baking spice flavors and a texture that's relatively soft for a red wine make this easy to drink and rich in flavor.

title: Illinois Sparkling Co. NV Brut Sparkling (Illinois)
description: The restrained nose of this Frontenac Gris and St. Pepin sparkling wine shows steely lemon and cheese rind notes. The palate brings a bit more character, with riper tones of crisp green apple and pear carried along by a mild mousse of bubbles.

title: Knapp 2014 Semi Dry Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Decadently ripe peach and blossom notes are accented by a curious touch of vanilla sugar in this sunny, off-dry Gewürztraminer. It's a hint reedy on the palate, but refreshingly brisk and easy drinking.
